news_header: Water bills in the UK are set to rise more than expected over the next five years to cover increased costs and necessary investments, with a significant overhaul of the water industry anticipated.
news_text: Water bills in the UK will increase by an average of £19 per year from 2025 to 2030, totaling a £94 increase or 21%. Ofwat is considering allowing even higher increases due to rising financing costs. The government plans to announce major reforms in the water industry aimed at protecting customers and addressing infrastructure challenges. The proposed increases vary by company, with Southern Water facing a 44% rise and Thames Water seeking a 59% increase. A new independent commission will be established to advise on industry improvements, reflecting widespread dissatisfaction with current regulations and performance.
